discussion.content: Correct answer is N, Y, Y. First box is No because User1 didn't get contributor role on RG1 directly. It was given to user1 as an inheritance from Management Group1. An inherited permission can be revoked only at the level where it was granted (Management Group1 in this case). So, there is no way to revoke this permission from user1 except revoking it at Management group level. I've tried this in my lab and this is the error received - "Inherited role assignments cannot be removed. Open the scope where the role was assigned and remove it from there."
